vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/9beb491a-50a4-4ad5-89c7-c5c88c652e4d">YOUNG ADULTS</keyword>         <topcClas>Housing</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>English Housing Survey</i> (EHS) is a continuous national survey commissioned by the Department for Communities and Local Government (DCLG) that collects information about people's housing circumstances and the condition and energy efficiency of housing in England. The EHS brings together two previous survey series into a single fieldwork operation: the <i>English House Condition Survey</i> (EHCS) (available from the UK Data Archive under GN 33158) and the <i>Survey of English Housing</i> (SEH) (available under GN 33277). The EHS covers all housing tenures and provides valuable information and evidence to inform the development and monitoring of the department's housing policies. Results from the survey are also used by a wide range of other users including other government departments, local authorities, housing associations, landlords, academics, construction industry professionals, consultants, and the general public. <br> <br> The EHS has a complex multi-stage methodology consisting of two main elements; an initial interview survey of around 14,000 households and a follow-up physical inspection. Some further elements are also periodically included in or derived from the EHS: for 2008 and 2009, a desk-based market valuation was conducted of a sub-sample of 8,000 dwellings (including vacant ones), but this was not carried out from 2010 onwards. A periodic follow-up survey of private landlords and agents (the <i>Private Landlords Survey</i> (PLS)) is conducted using information from the EHS interview survey and from 2012, a Fuel Poverty dataset is also deposited, created by the Department for Energy and Climate Change (DECC) from the EHS database.<br> <br> The EHS interview survey sample formed part of the Integrated Household Survey (IHS) (available from the Archive under GN 33420) from April 2008 to April 2011. During this period the core questions from the IHS formed part of the EHS questionnaire. <br> <br> Further information about the EHS and the latest news, reports and tables can be found on the GOV.UK <a href="https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-communities-and-local-government/series/english-housing-survey" title ="English Housing Survey (EHS)">English Housing Survey </a> web pages.<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract>The <i>Private Landlords Survey, 2010</i> (PLS), commissioned by the DCLG and carried out by ONS, was a national survey of landlords and managing agents who own and/or manage privately rented properties in England. The aim of the survey was to provide a snapshot of the composition and experience of landlords and how they (together with any agent) acquire, let, manage and maintain privately rented accommodation. A similar survey of private landlords was carried out by the DCLG (or predecessors) in the years 2001, 2003 and 2006 (only the 2010 survey is currently held at the UK Data Archive). As with previous years, the 2010 survey was based on information collated on DCLG's main housing survey. Respondents taking part in the ECHS 2007-2008 (see under SN 6449) and the EHS 2008-2009 (see under SN 7040) who were recorded as private renters were asked to provide details of their landlord. These details formed the main sample for the 2010 PLS.<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The interviews covered: respondent characteristics; landlord's portfolio; nationality/ethnicity; licensing; letting practice; acquisition of the rental property; current letting; financial information about current letting; tenancies that ended in last two years; repairs; neighbourhood; landlord problems.<br> </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="2010-04-06T00:00:00Z">06 April 2010</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2010-06-07T00:00:00Z">07 June 2010</collDate>         <nation>England</nation>         <geogUnit>Government Office Regions</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Landlords and agents identified in the ECHS 2007-2008 and the EHS 2008-2009, surveyed during 2010.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Repeated cross-sectional study</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>Office for National Statistics</dataCollector>         <sampProc>Multi-stage stratified random sample</sampProc>         <deviat>1,051 cases (landlord weight file); 1,109 (dwelling weight file)</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview; Telephone interview</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used. See documentation for details.</weight>         <cleanOps>A</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Available to all registered users for any use</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required. Available to all registered users. The depositor may be informed about usage.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relStdy>6612 English Housing Survey, 2008: Housing Stock Data </relStdy>       <relStdy>6613 English Housing Survey, 2008-2009: Household Data </relStdy>       <relStdy>6804 English Housing Survey, 2009: Housing Stock Data </relStdy>       <relStdy>6805 English Housing Survey, 2009-2010: Household Data </relStdy>       <relStdy>7039 English Housing Survey, 2010: Housing Stock Data </relStdy>       <relStdy>7040 English Housing Survey, 2010-2011: Household Data </relStdy>       <relStdy>7362 English Housing Survey, 2011-2012: Household Data </relStdy>       <relStdy>7386 English Housing Survey, 2011: Housing Stock Data </relStdy>       <relStdy>7511 English Housing Survey, 2012: Housing Stock Data </relStdy>       <relStdy>7512 English Housing Survey, 2012-2013: Household Data </relStdy>       <relStdy>7513 English Housing Survey: Housing Stock Data, 2010/11-2012/13: Three-Year Weights Lookup File </relStdy>       <relStdy>7539 English Housing Survey, 2012: Fuel Poverty Dataset </relStdy>       <relStdy>6923 English Housing Survey, 2008-2013: Secure Access </relStdy>       <relStdy>6949 English Housing Survey, 2008-2009: Household Data  Teaching Dataset </relStdy>       <relStdy>7471 Energy Follow Up Survey, 2011 </relStdy>       <relPubl>Department for Business Enterprise and Regulatory Reform (2008) <i>The UK Fuel Poverty Strategy: 6th Annual Progress Report 2008</i>, London: BERR.<br> <br> Department for Communities and Local Government (July 2012) <i>English Housing Survey 2010: Housing Stock Report</i>, London: DCLG. ISBN 978-1-4098-3472-4.<br> <br> Department for Communities and Local Government (July 2012) <i>English Housing Survey 2010-2011: Household Report</i>, London: DCLG. ISBN 978-1-4098-3473-1.<br> <br> Department for Communities and Local Government (2014) <I>English housing survey headline report 2012 to 2013</I>, London: DCLG. ISBN 9781409841524.<br> <br> Department for Communities and Local Government (2014) <I>English housing survey 2012 to 2013: household report</I>, London: DCLG. ISBN 9781409842774.<br> <br> Department of Energy and Climate Change (2014) <I>Annual fuel poverty statistics report, 2014</I>, retrieved July 30, 2014 from <a href="https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/fuel-poverty-statistics" title="Annual fuel poverty statistics report, 2014">https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/fuel-poverty-statistics</a> <br> <br> Further related publications, including bulletins and reports, may be found on the GOV.UK <a href="https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-communities-and-local-government/series/english-housing-survey#publications" title="English Housing Survey">English Housing Survey</a> webpages.<br></relPubl>       <relPubl>Equality and Human Rights Commission (2013) <i>Standard of Living</i>, Measurement Framework Series Briefing Paper no.10, Manchester: Equality and Human Rights Commission.<br></relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
